stimulusHtml: Which of the following claims best conveys the significance of endorsements by Frederick Douglass and other prominent African American leaders in the poster?

features.html:
• The poster contains extensive amounts of text of various sizes.

  • Only the largest text on the poster is legible. Line-by-line, it reads as follows:

    • Men of Color

    • To Arms! To Arms!

    • Now or Never

    • Three Years’ Service!

    • Battles of Liberty and the Union

    • Fail Now, and Our Race Is Doomed

    • Silence the Tongue of Calumny

    • Valor and Heroism

    • Port Hudson and Milliken’s Bend

    • Are Freemen Less Brave Than Slaves

    • Our Last Opportunity Has Come

    • Men of Color, Brothers and Fathers!

    • We Appeal to You!

    • Strike Now!

  • Small, illegible text appears throughout the poster between lines of large text.

Kean Collection / Staff / Getty Images

The seven columns of small-size text at the bottom of the poster include the names of many prominent African American community leaders, including that of Frederick Douglass.

choicesHtml: Anti-Black violence in the North caused a substantial drop in African Americans’ support for the war.
There was a widespread belief that African Americans joining the war effort would advance the cause of abolition.
Enslaved African Americans who had fled the South and free African Americans from the North both joined the Union war effort.
Some African American recruits in the Union military forces resented and protested against the unequal conditions of their service.
